noun.description: A tall recess or wardrobe with a door, used for storage.
Used to refer to a state of secrecy or concealment, especially about one's homosexuality.
examples: his brother's decision to come out of the closet
she tries to have a relationship with another woman while remaining in the closet

verb.description: Shut (someone) away, especially in private conference or study.
examples: he was closeted with the king
he returned home and closeted himself in his room

origin: Late Middle English (denoting a private or small room): from Old French, diminutive of clos closed (see close).
